model.high.editor

Interface Editor

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    EditorImp

    public interface Editor

    • Method Detail

      • getDocument

        Document getDocument()
        Returns:
        the document edited by the editor

      • getCursor

        Cursor getCursor()
        Returns:
        The cursor for the current document

      • getSelectedItem

        HasSubSection getSelectedItem()
        Returns:
        the section where the cursor is.

      • getSelectedLine

        Line getSelectedLine()
        Returns:
        the selected line in the document

      • getSelectedCharacterNb

        int getSelectedCharacterNb()
        Returns:
        The index of the cursor in the line.

      • addCommand

        void addCommand(Command c)
        Add a new Command in the editor. The user will then be able to call this command.
        Parameters:
        c - the command to add.

      • executeCommand

        void executeCommand(java.lang.String c)
        Execute the textual command.
        Parameters:
        c - the command.

      • loadDocument

        void loadDocument(java.lang.CharSequence filePath)
        Load the given document.
        Parameters:
        filePath - path to the document.

      • getCommandChar

        char getCommandChar()
        Returns:
        the character which starts every command.

      • moveCursor

        void moveCursor(int down,
              int right)
        move the cursor in the document. Given value can be positive or negative so it is possible to go to the left by setting a negative alue for right.
        Parameters:
        down - the number of line changes downward.
        right - the number of column changes to the right.

      • print

        java.lang.String print()
        Create a String to display the document.
        Returns:
        string to display.

      • newLine

        void newLine()
        Create a new line where the cursor currently is.

      • insertChar

        void insertChar(char c)
        Insert a character where the cursor currently is
        Parameters:
        c - the character to insert.
